content.question: Johanna jogs along a straight path. For 0 ≤ t ≤ 40, Johanna's velocity is given by a differentiable function v. Selected values of v(t), where t is measured in minutes and v(t) is measured in meters per minute, are given in the table above. (a) Use the data in the table to estimate the value of v'(16).

frqParts.text: Johanna jogs along a straight path. For 0 ≤ t ≤ 40, Johanna's velocity is given by a differentiable function v. Selected values of v(t), where t is measured in minutes and v(t) is measured in meters per minute, are given in the table above. (a) Use the data in the table to estimate the value of v'(16).

(b) Using correct units, explain the meaning of the definite integral <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXaWdaeaapeWaaqWaaeaacaWG2bWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadsha aiaawIcacaGLPaaaaiaawEa7caGLiWoaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaaWdae aapeGaaGinaiaaicdaa0Gaey4kIipakiaadsgacaWG0baaaa@4378@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of the problem. Approximate the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXaWdaeaapeWaaqWaaeaacaWG2bWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadsha aiaawIcacaGLPaaaaiaawEa7caGLiWoaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaaWdae aapeGaaGinaiaaicdaa0Gaey4kIipakiaadsgacaWG0baaaa@4378@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> using a right Riemann sum with the four subintervals indicated in the table.

(c) Bob is riding his bicycle along the same path. For 0 ≤ t ≤ 10, Bob's velocity is modeled by B(t) = t3 - 6t2 + 300, where t is measured in minutes and B(t) is measured in meters per minute. Find Bob's acceleration at time t = 5.
(d) Based on the model B from part (c), find Bob's average velocity during the interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 10.

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
